name: CKEDITOR.dom.selection
doc:
Manipulates the selection within a DOM element. If the current browser selection spans outside of the element, an empty selection object is returned.

Despite the fact that selection's constructor allows to create selection instances, usually it's better to get selection from the editor instance:

var sel = editor.getSelection();

See CKEDITOR.editor.getSelection.

members.name: document
members.doc: Document in which selection is anchored.

members.name: isFake
members.doc:
Whether selection is a fake selection.

See fake method.
members.short_doc: Whether selection is a fake selection. ...

members.name: isLocked
members.doc:
Whether selection is locked (cannot be modified).

See lock and unlock methods.
members.short_doc: Whether selection is locked (cannot be modified). ...

members.name: rev
members.doc: Selection's revision. This value is incremented every time new selection is created or existing one is modified.
members.short_doc: Selection's revision. ...

members.name: root
members.doc: Selection's root element.

members.name: constructor
members.doc:
Creates a selection class instance.

// Selection scoped in document.
var sel = new CKEDITOR.dom.selection( CKEDITOR.document );

// Selection scoped in element with 'editable' id.
var sel = new CKEDITOR.dom.selection( CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'editable' ) );

// Cloning selection.
var clone = new CKEDITOR.dom.selection( sel );

params.name: target
params.doc:
The DOM document/element that the DOM selection is restrained to. Only selection which spans within the target element is considered as valid.

If CKEDITOR.dom.selection is passed, then its clone will be created.
params.html_type: CKEDITOR.dom.document/CKEDITOR.dom.element/CKEDITOR.dom.selection

members.short_doc: Creates a selection class instance. ...

members.name: createBookmarks
members.doc:
Creates a bookmark for each range of this selection (from getRanges) by calling the CKEDITOR.dom.range.createBookmark method, with extra care taken to avoid interference among those ranges. The arguments received are the same as with the underlying range method.

var bookmarks = editor.getSelection().createBookmarks();
members.short_doc:
Creates a bookmark for each range of this selection (from getRanges)
by calling the CKEDITOR.dom.range.createBookmark...

members.name: createBookmarks2
members.doc:
Creates a bookmark for each range of this selection (from getRanges) by calling the CKEDITOR.dom.range.createBookmark2 method, with extra care taken to avoid interference among those ranges. The arguments received are the same as with the underlying range method.

var bookmarks = editor.getSelection().createBookmarks2();
members.short_doc:
Creates a bookmark for each range of this selection (from getRanges)
by calling the CKEDITOR.dom.range.createBookmark...

members.name: fake
members.doc:
Makes a "fake selection" of an element.

A fake selection does not render UI artifacts over the selected element. Additionally, the browser native selection system is not aware of the fake selection. In practice, the native selection is moved to a hidden place where no native selection UI artifacts are displayed to the user.
members.short_doc: Makes a "fake selection" of an element. ...

members.name: getCommonAncestor
members.doc:
Retrieves the common ancestor node of the first range and the last range.

var ancestor = editor.getSelection().getCommonAncestor();

return.name: return
return.doc: The common ancestor of the selection or null if selection is empty.

members.short_doc: Retrieves the common ancestor node of the first range and the last range. ...

members.name: getNative
members.doc:
Gets the native selection object from the browser.

var selection = editor.getSelection().getNative();
members.short_doc: Gets the native selection object from the browser. ...

members.name: getRanges
members.doc:
Retrieves the CKEDITOR.dom.range instances that represent the current selection.

Note: Some browsers return multiple ranges even for a continuous selection. Firefox, for example, returns one range for each table cell when one or more table rows are selected.

var ranges = selection.getRanges();
alert( ranges.length );

params.name: onlyEditables
params.doc: If set to true, this function retrives editable ranges only.

return.name: return
return.doc: Range instances that represent the current selection.

members.short_doc: Retrieves the CKEDITOR.dom.range instances that represent the current selection. ...

members.name: getSelectedElement
members.doc:
Gets the currently selected element.

var element = editor.getSelection().getSelectedElement();
alert( element.getName() );

return.name: return
return.doc: The selected element. Null if no selection is available or the selection type is not CKEDITOR.SELECTION_ELEMENT.

members.short_doc: Gets the currently selected element. ...

members.name: getSelectedText
members.doc:
Retrieves the text contained within the range. An empty string is returned for non-text selection.

var text = editor.getSelection().getSelectedText();
alert( text );

return.name: return
return.doc: A string of text within the current selection.

members.short_doc: Retrieves the text contained within the range. ...

members.name: getStartElement
members.doc:
Gets the DOM element in which the selection starts.

var element = editor.getSelection().getStartElement();
alert( element.getName() );

return.name: return
return.doc: The element at the beginning of the selection.

members.short_doc: Gets the DOM element in which the selection starts. ...

members.name: getType
members.doc:
Gets the type of the current selection. The following values are available:

  • CKEDITOR.SELECTION_NONE (1): No selection.
  • CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TEXT (2): A text or a collapsed selection is selected.
  • CKEDITOR.SELECTION_ELEMENT (3): An element is selected.

Example:

if ( editor.getSelection().getType() == CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TEXT )
    alert( 'A text is selected' );

return.name: return
return.doc: One of the following constant values: CKEDITOR.SELECTION_NONE, CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TEXT or CKEDITOR.SELECTION_ELEMENT.

members.short_doc: Gets the type of the current selection. ...

members.name: isHidden
members.doc:
Checks whether selection is placed in hidden element.

This method is to be used to verify whether fake selection (see fake) is still hidden.

Note: this method should be executed on real selection - e.g.:

editor.getSelection( true ).isHidden();
members.short_doc: Checks whether selection is placed in hidden element. ...

members.name: lock
members.doc:
Locks the selection made in the editor in order to make it possible to manipulate it without browser interference. A locked selection is cached and remains unchanged until it is released with the unlock method.

editor.getSelection().lock();
members.short_doc:
Locks the selection made in the editor in order to make it possible to
manipulate it without browser interference. ...

members.name: removeAllRanges
members.doc: Remove all the selection ranges from the document.
members.short_doc: Remove all the selection ranges from the document. ...

members.name: reset
members.doc:
Clears the selection cache.

editor.getSelection().reset();
members.short_doc: Clears the selection cache. ...

members.name: scrollIntoView
members.doc:
Moves the scrollbar to the starting position of the current selection.

editor.getSelection().scrollIntoView();
members.short_doc: Moves the scrollbar to the starting position of the current selection. ...

members.name: selectBookmarks
members.doc:
Selects the virtual ranges denoted by the bookmarks by calling selectRanges.

var bookmarks = editor.getSelection().createBookmarks();
editor.getSelection().selectBookmarks( bookmarks );

params.name: bookmarks
params.doc: The bookmarks representing ranges to be selected.

return.name: return
return.doc: This selection object, after the ranges were selected.

members.short_doc: Selects the virtual ranges denoted by the bookmarks by calling selectRanges. ...

members.name: selectElement
members.doc:
Makes the current selection of type CKEDITOR.SELECTION_ELEMENT by enclosing the specified element.

var element = editor.document.getById( 'sampleElement' );
editor.getSelection().selectElement( element );

params.name: element
params.doc: The element to enclose in the selection.

members.short_doc: Makes the current selection of type CKEDITOR.SELECTION_ELEMENT by enclosing the specified element. ...

members.name: selectRanges
members.doc:
Clears the original selection and adds the specified ranges to the document selection.

    // Move selection to the end of the editable element.
var range = editor.createRange();
range.moveToPosition( range.root, CKEDITOR.POSITION_BEFORE_END );
editor.getSelection().selectRanges( [ ranges ] );

params.name: ranges
params.doc: An array of CKEDITOR.dom.range instances representing ranges to be added to the document.

members.short_doc: Clears the original selection and adds the specified ranges to the document selection. ...

members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

short_doc: Manipulates the selection within a DOM element. ...
